ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When they see a Sign they only laugh with scorn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When they see a sign, they laugh at it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and if they see any Sign, they laugh it away
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and when they see a miracle, they mock
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And whenever they see a sign, they mock at it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when they see an Ayah (a sign) from Allah, they mock at it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when they see a sign they incite one another to scoff,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and, when they see a sign, would scoff;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And seek to scoff when they behold a portent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and whenever they see some sign, they ridicule it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when they behold a sign, they turn to scoffing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and when they see a sign they make it an object of ridicule,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And, when they see a Sign, turn it to mockery,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when they see an Ayah (a sign, a proof, or an evidence) from Allah, they mock at it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When they are shown a sign, they scoff at it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And when they see a sign, they ridicule.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when they see a sign, they ridicule
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:14] and when they see a sign, such as the splitting of the moon [cf. Q. 54:1], they make it an object of ridicule, they deride it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And seek to scoff when they) the people of Mecca (behold a portent) a sign such as the splitting of the moon and the eclipse of the sun.
